revised_title: Investigations into Cathode Rays and Their Deflection
tldr: The author investigates the behavior of cathode rays and their deflection by electrically charged objects. They discover that cathode rays can be deflected electrostatically and that the size of a cathodic shadow depends on the electric state of the object. The author also identifies and describes para-cathodic rays, which are emitted from the anti-cathode and have similar properties to Rontgen rays.
